author: John Arbour
title: ADA Powers Incentive Apps
description: Easy GTM strategy for ADA to drive wider adoption and liquidity.

assessments.note: The subject of the proposal definitely interesting and fits within the challenge. I would love to see a detailed plan to implement API for loyalty programs. However, in the current form, the proposal is too vague to justify positive evaluation.

In general the proposal is a draft and there are no details, so there is no way to assess whether the proposal will address the challenge. There is no mention of which apps the proposal refers to in the solution description, in addition the problem statement doesn't present a problem.
This proposal seems to be still in the idea stage and as such does not effectively address the challenge.
I am not sure was is proposed. Creating incentive programs and gift-cards or create an api that allows other applications to buy ada for the purpose of the topics I stated before.

The way how this proposal is put together at the moment - it is very challenging to judge its potential impact. We can't really - as there isn't enough information provided at all. Knowing how it would align with greater goals of cardano community would be useful.
Just an idea presented with no details of technology to be used and tasks involved.
The problem statement isn't a problem but a statement. The strategy to bring cardano adoption is not explained by GTM, and the problem is not identified or quantified.
There is not enough information to address the challenge
No plan was presented. Looks like the proposal was abandoned since the last edit was made over two weeks before the deadline.
There is no described plan and there is not enough information about the team, so it is not possible to define the chances of the proposal being successfully implemented.
There is insufficient clear information about the team's experience and there is just a skeleton of a plan.
provided information about experience is minimal and there is no plan on how they want to implemnt the proposal.

Not enough information provided at the present stage. There is no experience validity established with some references to external links. Nor do we have a grasp of how budget is the right amount. How is it going to be spent, what deliverables can we expect to be sourced with it? None of these important questions are addressed.
There is no plan or relevant experience for the product being demonstrated in the proposal.
While proposal mentions great programs that will bring additional use of cardano, it lacks any details on how this will be accomplished. no timeline, budget, or scope.
There is not enough information to show the experience of the team.
In the current version, the proposal does not provide any information that can be meaningfully evaluated
There is not enough information to assess the feasibility or how the proposal is addressing the challenge. An app was mentioned, but in an unintelligible context.
I think that this proposal is still in an inception stage and it does not provide enough data to allow me to assess its feasibility and how it really addresses the challenge.
It is not really stated what they want to do and how they want to do it. Disappointing.

Because this is such modest proposal of few words only - there really is no indication of roadmap, milestones, success metrics, challenges/risks, etc. Would really like to explore more how this proposal could do better next time but it really needs more effort to be put into. It isn't investable by any means at the moment.
The information in the proposal is not enough to analyse the proposal
The proposal doesn't provide any estimate of the reach of the app or estimate on how many people may adopt the use of the dapp.
There is no roadmap or milestones to specify step by step plan at all.

solution: Drive ADA adoption by powering loyalty, gift card, and incentive programs by building a simple API for these apps.
experience: We are a team of long time software developers (4 companies and 2 exits) and business professionals.
